medical_history.chief_complaint: Weight loss, low-grade fever, drenching night sweats, and productive cough.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4-5 years prior to admission with intermittent back and migratory peripheral joint pain, worsening in the lower back and sacroiliac joints 9 months before admission. Recent worsening occurred with new symptoms including low-grade fever, night sweats, lethargy, and anorexia starting two months before admission. The patient reported a 15 kg weight loss over 4 months and a 6-week history of a productive cough.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No chronic medical issues or allergies; previously diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis, treated with secukinumab and later adalimumab without improvement.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a man in his 40s from an urban area, married, never smoked, consumes 70-80 g of alcohol weekly, and travels once or twice yearly to underdeveloped tropical countries for work.
